channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Report Says Illegal Aliens Responsible for Up to 75% of Violent Crime Arrests in Midtown Manhattan
item.description: New York City is in the midst of a violent migrant crime wave. According to a recent report by the New York Post, illegal aliens account for up to 75 ...

item.title: Fed moves to protect weakening job market with bold rate cut
item.description: The move signals that the central bank is growing nervous about the declining labor market.

item.title: Tech Jobs Have Dried Up---and Aren't Coming Back Soon
item.description: Employment for software engineers has cooled as resources shift toward developing artificial intelligence.

item.title: Joe Biden preps to sell the economy — to boost his legacy and help Harris
item.description: Biden is determined to convince a skeptical public that he strengthened the economy.

item.title: Meta to European Union: Your Tech Rules Threaten to Squelch AI Boom
item.description: The Facebook parent and other companies are warning in an open letter that the regulations risk hampering innovation and economic growth.

item.title: Harris and Trump essentially tied in Pennsylvania, Post poll finds

item.title: Vance’s media strategy takes a turn
item.description: He was Trump’s policy whisperer to key voting blocs. Now, he’s fueling rumors that Haitian immigrants in Ohio are eating cats and dogs.

item.title: Want an iPhone 16 Review? Just Ask Joannabot
item.description: After more than a decade of reviewing iPhones, columnist Joanna Stern has handed the reins to her generative-AI assistant to discuss Apple’s latest.

item.title: Trump stumps on Long Island, vowing to ‘win New York’ after losing big twice

item.title: Weed, wages and same-sex marriage: The most intriguing ballot measures that voters will decide in November
item.description: Across the U.S. in November, voters will weigh proposals on election policies, minimum wage increases and marijuana legalization.

item.title: Craigslist Founder Pledges $100 Million to Boost U.S. Cybersecurity
item.description: Donation brings Craig Newmark’s charitable commitments to around $400 million.

item.title: Scarred by violence, lawmakers plan for possible ‘mass casualty’ event
item.description: Congress must ensure it can continue to govern in the aftermath of mass violence, a bipartisan group of House members argue.

item.title: Amazon's Return-to-Office Plans Spark Concern and Debate Among Employees
item.description: Corporate staffers grumbled after the e-commerce giant told workers to be in the office full time starting next year.

item.title: Day by day, how JD Vance tweeted misinformation about Springfield
item.description: Despite his staff learning that the cat-eating story wasn’t true on the day of his first post, Vance doubled down and kept going.
